content:
Hey everyone — I’ve been working quietly on something for months, and today it’s finally ready.

I call it **Continuum Pro**.

If you’ve followed my writing here, you know I’ve been obsessed with one question:

**How do we create *permanence* inside an ecosystem built for speed and ephemerality?**

Relays prune.  
Clients forget.  
Links break.  
But our long-form work — the things that actually matter — shouldn’t disappear.

So I built a solution.

Continuum Pro creates a **sovereign long-form archive** for your npub under Continuum’s domain, with a clean viewer and a permanent, portable directory of all your kind:30023 posts. Everything is open, static, and relay-independent.

You just give me your npub.  
I handle the rest — exporting, archiving, indexing, publishing.

Pricing is simple:

- $250 (or $225 if you pay in Bitcoin) for the first npub  
- +$100 per additional npub (up to 5)  
- enterprise pricing for 6+  

And one more thing — a perk I really wanted to include:

**Continuum Pro members get full access to all my paid articles.**

That includes:
- The entire backlog  
- Every new paid article going forward  
- PDF versions  
- Clean Markdown versions  
- And canonical event files for your own archive  

If you’ve followed my writing, you know how much time, energy, and prayer goes into these. Pro members get all of it.

And yes — this includes the full local Continuum app, which lets you manage **unlimited npubs** on your own machine.

If you want your Nostr identity to have a real archive — something that will last, something not dependent on relays — DM me (@Akamaister) or the Continuum Magazine account and I’ll get you set up.

Thanks to everyone who’s encouraged me along the way. This one feels like a milestone.
